intro: Diplolepis ovata, commonly known as the common bramble, is a shrub native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that bloom in summer, followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in a variety of soil types and is often found in hedgerows and woodland edges. Its botanical features make it a common and adaptable species within its native range.
